rio.name: PBD.plug
rio.log: Activate the specified PBD, causing the referenced SR to be attached and scanned

rio.name: PBD.unplug
rio.log: Deactivate the specified PBD, causing the referenced SR to be detached and nolonger scanned

rio.name: PIF.create_VLAN
rio.log: Create a VLAN interface from an existing physical interface

rio.name: PIF.destroy
rio.log: Destroy the PIF object (provided it is a VLAN interface)

rio.name: SR.create
rio.log: Create a new Storage Repository and introduce it into the managed system, creating both SR record and PBD record to attach it to current host (with specified device_config parameters)

rio.name: SR.destroy
rio.log: Destroy specified SR, removing SR-record from database and remove SR from disk. (In order to affect this operation the appropriate device_config is read from the specified SR's PBD on current host)

rio.name: SR.forget
rio.log: Removing specified SR-record from database, without attempting to remove SR from disk

rio.name: SR.get_supported_types
rio.log: Return a set of all the SR types supported by the system

rio.name: SR.introduce
rio.log: Introduce a new Storage Repository into the managed system

rio.name: SR.make
rio.log: Create a new Storage Repository on disk

rio.name: SR.scan
rio.log: Refreshes the list of VDIs associated with an SR

rio.name: SR.set_name_description
rio.log: Set the name description of the SR

rio.name: SR.set_name_label
rio.log: Set the name label of the SR

rio.name: SR.set_shared
rio.log: Sets the shared flag on the SR

rio.name: VBD.assert_attachable
rio.log: Throws an error if this VBD could not be attached to this VM if the VM were running. Intended for debugging.

rio.name: VBD.eject
rio.log: Remove the media from the device and leave it empty

rio.name: VBD.insert
rio.log: Insert new media into the device

rio.name: VBD.plug
rio.log: Hotplug the specified VBD, dynamically attaching it to the running VM

rio.name: VBD.set_mode
rio.log: Sets the mode of the VBD. The power_state of the VM must be halted.

rio.name: VBD.unplug
rio.log: Hot-unplug the specified VBD, dynamically unattaching it from the running VM

rio.name: VBD.unplug_force
rio.log: Forcibly unplug the specified VBD

rio.name: VDI.clone
rio.log: Take an exact copy of the VDI and return a reference to the new disk. If any driver_params are specified then these are passed through to the storage-specific substrate driver that implements the clone operation. NB the clone lives in the same Storage Repository as its parent.

rio.name: VDI.copy
rio.log: Copies a VDI to an SR. There must be a host that can see both the source and destination SRs simultaneously

rio.name: VDI.forget
rio.log: Removes a VDI record from the database

rio.name: VDI.resize
rio.log: Resize the VDI.

rio.name: VDI.resize_online
rio.log: Resize the VDI which may or may not be attached to running guests.

rio.name: VDI.set_name_description
rio.log: Set the name description of the VDI. This can only happen when its SR is currently attached.

rio.name: VDI.set_name_label
rio.log: Set the name label of the VDI. This can only happen when then its SR is currently attached.

rio.name: VDI.set_read_only
rio.log: Sets the VDI's read_only field

rio.name: VDI.snapshot
rio.log: Take a read-only snapshot of the VDI, returning a reference to the snapshot. If any driver_params are specified then these are passed through to the storage-specific substrate driver that takes the snapshot. NB the snapshot lives in the same Storage Repository as its parent.

rio.name: VIF.plug
rio.log: Hotplug the specified VIF, dynamically attaching it to the running VM

rio.name: VIF.unplug
rio.log: Hot-unplug the specified VIF, dynamically unattaching it from the running VM

rio.name: VM.add_to_VCPUs_params_live
rio.log: Add the given key-value pair to VM.VCPUs_params, and apply that value on the running VM

rio.name: VM.assert_can_boot_here
rio.log: Returns an error if the VM could not boot on this host for some reason

rio.name: VM.assert_operation_valid
rio.log: Check to see whether this operation is acceptable in the current state of the system, raising an error if the operation is invalid for some reason

rio.name: VM.clean_reboot
rio.log: Attempt to cleanly shutdown the specified VM (Note: this may not be supported---e.g. if a guest agent is not installed). This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Running state.

rio.name: VM.clean_shutdown
rio.log: Attempt to cleanly shutdown the specified VM. (Note: this may not be supported---e.g. if a guest agent is not installed). This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Running state.

rio.name: VM.clone
rio.log: Clones the specified VM, making a new VM. Clone automatically exploits the capabilities of the underlying storage repository in which the VM's disk images are stored (e.g. Copy on Write).   This function can only be called when the VM is in the Halted State.

rio.name: VM.copy
rio.log: Copies a VM to an SR. There must be a host that can see both the source and destination SRs simultaneously

rio.name: VM.get_allowed_VBD_devices
rio.log: Returns a list of the allowed values that a VBD device field can take

rio.name: VM.get_allowed_VIF_devices
rio.log: Returns a list of the allowed values that a VIF device field can take

rio.name: VM.get_boot_record
rio.log: Returns a record describing the VM's dynamic state, initialised when the VM boots and updated to reflect runtime configuration changes e.g. CPU hotplug

rio.name: VM.get_possible_hosts
rio.log: Return the list of hosts on which this VM may run.

rio.name: VM.hard_reboot
rio.log: Stop executing the specified VM without attempting a clean shutdown and immediately restart the VM.

rio.name: VM.hard_shutdown
rio.log: Stop executing the specified VM without attempting a clean shutdown.

rio.name: VM.pause
rio.log: Pause the specified VM. This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Running state.

rio.name: VM.pool_migrate
rio.log: Migrate a VM to another Host.

rio.name: VM.power_state_reset
rio.log: Reset the power-state of the VM to halted in the database only. (Used to recover from slave failures in pooling scenarios by resetting the power-states of VMs running on dead slaves to halted.) This is a potentially dangerous operation; use with care.

rio.name: VM.provision
rio.log: Inspects the disk configuration contained within the VM's other_config, creates VDIs and VBDs and then executes any applicable post-install script.

rio.name: VM.resume
rio.log: Awaken the specified VM and resume it.  This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Suspended state.

rio.name: VM.resume_on
rio.log: Awaken the specified VM and resume it on a particular Host.  This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Suspended state.

rio.name: VM.send_sysrq
rio.log: Send the given key as a sysrq to this VM.  The key is specified as a single character (a String of length 1).  This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Running state.

rio.name: VM.send_trigger
rio.log: Send the named trigger to this VM.  This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Running state.

rio.name: VM.set_HVM_boot_policy
rio.log: Set the VM.HVM_boot_policy field of the given VM, which will take effect when it is next started

rio.name: VM.set_VCPUs_number_live
rio.log: Set the number of VCPUs for a running VM

rio.name: VM.set_actions_after_crash
rio.log: Sets the actions_after_crash parameter

rio.name: VM.set_memory_target_live
rio.log: Set the memory target for a running VM

rio.name: VM.set_shadow_multiplier_live
rio.log: Set the shadow memory multiplier on a running VM

rio.name: VM.start
rio.log: Start the specified VM.  This function can only be called with the VM is in the Halted State.

rio.name: VM.start_on
rio.log: Start the specified VM on a particular host.  This function can only be called with the VM is in the Halted State.

rio.name: VM.suspend
rio.log: Suspend the specified VM to disk.  This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Running state.

rio.name: VM.unpause
rio.log: Resume the specified VM. This can only be called when the specified VM is in the Paused state.

rio.name: VM.update_allowed_operations
rio.log: Recomputes the list of acceptable operations

rio.name: crashdump.destroy
rio.log: Destroy the specified crashdump

rio.name: event.get_current_id
rio.log: Return the ID of the next event to be generated by the system

rio.name: event.next
rio.log: Blocking call which returns a (possibly empty) batch of events. This method is only recommended for legacy use. New development should use event.from which supersedes this method.

rio.name: event.register
rio.log: Registers this session with the event system for a set of given classes. This method is only recommended for legacy use in conjunction with event.next.

rio.name: event.unregister
rio.log: Removes this session's registration with the event system for a set of given classes. This method is only recommended for legacy use in conjunction with event.next.

rio.name: host.bugreport_upload
rio.log: Run xen-bugtool --yestoall and upload the output to support

rio.name: host.destroy
rio.log: Destroy specified host record in database

rio.name: host.disable
rio.log: Puts the host into a state in which no new VMs can be started. Currently active VMs on the host continue to execute.

rio.name: host.dmesg
rio.log: Get the host xen dmesg.

rio.name: host.dmesg_clear
rio.log: Get the host xen dmesg, and clear the buffer.

rio.name: host.enable
rio.log: Puts the host into a state in which new VMs can be started.

rio.name: host.get_log
rio.log: Get the host's log file

rio.name: host.license_apply
rio.log: Apply a new license to a host

rio.name: host.list_methods
rio.log: List all supported methods

rio.name: host.reboot
rio.log: Reboot the host. (This function can only be called if there are no currently running VMs on the host and it is disabled.)

rio.name: host.restart_agent
rio.log: Restarts the agent after a 10 second pause. WARNING: this is a dangerous operation. Any operations in progress will be aborted, and unrecoverable data loss may occur. The caller is responsible for ensuring that there are no operations in progress when this method is called.

rio.name: host.send_debug_keys
rio.log: Inject the given string as debugging keys into Xen

rio.name: host.shutdown
rio.log: Shutdown the host. (This function can only be called if there are no currently running VMs on the host and it is disabled.)

rio.name: host_crashdump.destroy

rio.name: host_patch.destroy
rio.log: Destroy the specified host patch, removing it from the disk. This does NOT reverse the patch

rio.name: pool.create_VLAN
rio.log: Create PIFs, mapping a network to the same physical interface/VLAN on each host. This call is deprecated: use Pool.create_VLAN_from_PIF instead.

rio.name: pool.create_VLAN_from_PIF
rio.log: Create a pool-wide VLAN by taking the PIF.

rio.name: pool.emergency_transition_to_master
rio.log: Instruct host that's currently a slave to transition to being master

rio.name: pool.join
rio.log: Instruct host to join a new pool

rio.name: pool.join_force
rio.log: Instruct host to join a new pool

rio.name: pool.recover_slaves
rio.log: Instruct a pool master, M, to try and contact its slaves and, if slaves are in emergency mode, reset their master address to M.

rio.name: pool.sync_database
rio.log: Forcibly synchronise the database now

inverness.name: VDI.data_destroy
inverness.log: Delete the data of the snapshot VDI, but keep its changed block tracking metadata. When successful, this call changes the type of the VDI to cbt_metadata. This operation is idempotent: calling it on a VDI of type cbt_metadata results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

inverness.name: VDI.disable_cbt
inverness.log: Disable changed block tracking for the VDI. This call is only allowed on VDIs that support enabling CBT. It is an idempotent operation - disabling CBT for a VDI for which CBT is not enabled results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

inverness.name: VDI.enable_cbt
inverness.log: Enable changed block tracking for the VDI. This call is idempotent - enabling CBT for a VDI for which CBT is already enabled results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

inverness.name: VDI.get_nbd_info
inverness.log: Get details specifying how to access this VDI via a Network Block Device server. For each of a set of NBD server addresses on which the VDI is available, the return value set contains a vdi_nbd_server_info object that contains an exportname to request once the NBD connection is established, and connection details for the address. An empty list is returned if there is no network that has a PIF on a host with access to the relevant SR, or if no such network has been assigned an NBD-related purpose in its purpose field. To access the given VDI, any of the vdi_nbd_server_info objects can be used to make a connection to a server, and then the VDI will be available by requesting the exportname.

inverness.name: VDI.list_changed_blocks
inverness.log: Compare two VDIs in 64k block increments and report which blocks differ. This operation is not allowed when vdi_to is attached to a VM.

inverness.name: VM.set_bios_strings
inverness.log: Set custom BIOS strings to this VM. VM will be given a default set of BIOS strings, only some of which can be overridden by the supplied values. Allowed keys are: 'bios-vendor', 'bios-version', 'system-manufacturer', 'system-product-name', 'system-version', 'system-serial-number', 'enclosure-asset-tag', 'baseboard-manufacturer', 'baseboard-product-name', 'baseboard-version', 'baseboard-serial-number', 'baseboard-asset-tag', 'baseboard-location-in-chassis', 'enclosure-asset-tag'

lima.log: Version of cluster stack, not writable via the API. Defaulting to 2 for backwards compatibility when upgrading from a cluster without this field, which means it is necessarily running version 2 of corosync, the only cluster stack supported so far.

lima.log: Internal field used by Host.destroy to store the IP of cluster members marked as permanently dead but not yet removed

lima.name: Cluster.uuid

lima.name: Cluster_host.PIF
lima.log: Reference to the PIF object

lima.name: Cluster_host.cluster
lima.log: Reference to the Cluster object

lima.name: Cluster_host.enabled
lima.log: Whether the cluster host believes that clustering should be enabled on this host. This field can be altered by calling the enable/disable message on a cluster host. Only enabled members run the underlying cluster stack. Disabled members are still considered a member of the cluster (see joined), and can be re-enabled by the user.

lima.name: Cluster_host.host
lima.log: Reference to the Host object

lima.name: Cluster_host.joined
lima.log: Whether the cluster host has joined the cluster. Contrary to enabled, a host that is not joined is not considered a member of the cluster, and hence enable and disable operations cannot be performed on this host.

lima.name: Cluster_host.other_config

lima.log: Unique identifier/object reference

lima.name: probe_result.complete
lima.log: True if this configuration is complete and can be used to call SR.create. False if it requires further iterative calls to SR.probe, to potentially narrow down on a configuration that can be used.

lima.name: probe_result.configuration
lima.log: Plugin-specific configuration which describes where and how to locate the storage repository. This may include the physical block device name, a remote NFS server and path or an RBD storage pool.

lima.name: probe_result.extra_info
lima.log: Additional plugin-specific information about this configuration, that might be of use for an API user. This can for example include the LUN or the WWPN.

lima.name: probe_result.sr

lima.name: sr_stat.health

lima.name: sr_stat.total_space

lima.name: Cluster_host.enable

lima.name: SR.probe_ext
lima.log: Perform a backend-specific scan, using the given device_config.  If the device_config is complete, then this will return a list of the SRs present of this type on the device, if any.  If the device_config is partial, then a backend-specific scan will be performed, returning results that will guide the user in improving the device_config.
